Articles.Content:
Deleted darned robotics, made a Munar lander, crashed it gently on the Mun and broke the command module off it.

Next task : rescue Wehreny Kerman from the Mun.

Spawned a random rocket made with the new parts to test the new optimizations and parts.

Oh boy.

It's so much faster AND beautiful.

I can't believe I'd ever play ksp like this, ever.
First thing I did was get to the moon to plant me a flag.
I first admired the less CPU usage and then looked at the parts. The first mission broke two things... The sound barrier, and Jebediah's eardrums.
First thing I did.
Landed on the mun.
Do I even need to tell you.
First thing I did was get really mad because my game won't launch rockets. Crashes every single time. Pretty lame.

First thing I did was get really mad because my game won't launch rockets. Crashes every single time. Pretty lame.

What does the log says? Are you having any mods installed?

I started a new game, and took a trip to Mun and back :3

"Jeb was here"

That flag looks like Iron Maiden's "Eddie" kerbalized. Am I right??

Dude. That's Invader Zim. He's awesome. Made my childhood awesome. I still watch him on Amazon to this day...

What does the log says? Are you having any mods installed?

I have tons of mods, just did a fresh install so I can add them one by one. That's not what I wanted to do after work though. I just want to play.

Freaked out because I made the mistake of copying my .20 install into my existing .19 folder, resulting in a ton of duplicated parts, parts without textures, etc etc.

Finally got things sorted out.

What you need to do, FYI, is make a new folder for the .20 and then just copy your saves and ships into it. Then reinstall any mods you need.

Set up a fresh install, no mods except MechJeb, and added my flag to the library. Then I took Jeb for a little jaunt in his favourite lawn chair.

OK, so we went a little higher than I originally intended...
Sent cupola into orbit.

Finally got my parts all sorted out.. After which I sent a simple 1.25m Munar orbiter to the Mun and brought it back. I need to get a new LKO station up, but I'm having problems with Mechjeb wanting to do crazy things, so I have to fly them manually. I really suck at launching manually.

I have tons of mods, just did a fresh install so I can add them one by one. That's not what I wanted to do after work though. I just want to play.

I also had alot of mods, i made an new folder in gamedata, and pasted in all the mods ex ksp020/gamedata/ahappydudesmod/holligansballoons

Worked for me, also adding Part

} before the name in cfg files

I love that new lander can, it is so light and IVA is great

IÃ‚Â´ve never been to Gilly and Ike, so I think it is time for my new low gravity lander to take some missions

Launched. Crashed. then waited 2 minutes while the log screen thought about going to the VAB or the space center or restarting, and being forced to stare at it waiting, as any time I'd alt-tab to another window (chrome) it would force me back, as if it had finally made a decision but, nope, still thinking. I suspect this is a problem with playing in Windowed mode.

Still trying to launch something into orbit using the new bits. It does seems smoother however, when I'm not crashing rockets.

I've actually gotten a drop in performance.. Also whenever I end a flight it seems like a 50/50 chance of the game crashing, Though that could be because of the Nova Punch, KW, or MechJeb mods. Still haven't gotten anything accomplished and probably won't try to until they come out with a patch.

The first thing i did was launch to the Mun to plant a flag

http://imgur.com/a/DICNe#0

Weirdly enough the Neil Armstrong memorial is floating pretty far above the ground.

P.S. Flags can be planted on eastereggs

It was the only possible course of action:

Sadly, it was a short flight.

Launched. Crashed. then waited 2 minutes while the log screen thought about going to the VAB or the space center or restarting, and being forced to stare at it waiting, as any time I'd alt-tab to another window (chrome) it would force me back, as if it had finally made a decision but, nope, still thinking. I suspect this is a problem with playing in Windowed mode.

Still trying to launch something into orbit using the new bits. It does seems smoother however, when I'm not crashing rockets.

Right click on your KSP shortcut and goto properties. Add '-popupwindow' at the end of your 'target' field.

There! My space station is now finished:

And I gave it the very imaginative name Kerbal Space Station, and made a flag to match:

There! My space station is now finished:

And I gave it the very imaginative name Kerbal Space Station, and made a flag to match:

What? No SRB rockets to ward off attacks from those pesky Dresians. Also, fine work, sir.
